thread.title: The Obamas Might Sell Their Memoirs For A Record-Breaking Amount Of Money - BuzzFeed News
thread.title_full: The Obamas Might Sell Their Memoirs For A Record-Breaking Amount Of Money - BuzzFeed News

author: Jarry Lee
title: The Obamas Might Sell Their Memoirs For A Record-Breaking Amount Of Money - BuzzFeed News
text:
While the rights are being sold together, the books are being written and published separately. ID: 10614399 3. Penguin Random House, HarperCollins, Simon & Schuster, and Macmillan are among the publishing houses participating in the auction, FT reports, with Penguin Random House (which published Barack’s three previous books) currently in the lead. View this image ›
Tim Boyle / Getty Images ID: 10614625 4. If sold for $60 million, the Obamas’ book deal would break a record for presidential memoirs — George W. Bush’s and Bill Clinton’s sold for $10m and $15m, respectively. As the FT reports:
Knopf, a division of Penguin Random House, paid $15m for the rights to Bill Clinton’s 2004 memoirs My Life when he left the White House, while George W Bush made an estimated $10m from his book Decision Points, which was published by Crown.
Via ft.com ID: 10614429 CNN later confirmed the bidding war.
BuzzFeed News has reached out to several of the book publishers involved for comment.
ID: 10614482 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
